other_tests.findings: A period of fast, sustained ventricular tachycardia that was treated with an internal shock, showing low impedance of 24 Ω. The first shock was followed by 22 s of ventricular fibrillation, and a second shock converted the patient back into sinus rhythm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 2 months later, during a skiing incident, the device converted ventricular tachycardia back into sinus rhythm with normal shock impedance of 64 Ω, without causing skin redness.

other_tests.findings: Device confirmed to be working properly, delivering shocks with normal impedance of 57 Ω and a fixed energy level of 80 J.
